{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3600760,"name":"Eli Milholland","username":"Bobert9000","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/50afbb/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T00:16:50.311Z","cooked":"

I’ve already made at an offseason mini turret that we showcased in our pits in our 2 districts (didn’t have time in state and worlds). I’m looking to take the next step in building it and am looking for advice on
1: how to drive it
2: torque/ rpms
3: how many degrees of rotation should be possible
we’re thinking around 6000rpm and 270 degrees of rotation
we want it to be able to make a 3point shot on a basketball hoop consistently (95/100 makes)

And you have checked on 2012 robots for ideas already, I assume?

If you weren’t aware, 2012 was basketball.

2022 may also give some ideas.

Depending on the motor 6000 rpm is likely too high, the motor won’t have enough torque

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T13:14:04.034Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":405,"readers_count":404,"score":86.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500221,"topic_slug":"were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project","display_username":"James Lyon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71354,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8410 Mechanical Lead "},"post_url":"/t/were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project/500221/3","custom_user_title":"8410 Mechanical Lead ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3601174,"name":"Miles.D","username":"jom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jom/{size}/256684_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T13:39:12.635Z","cooked":"

We have never made a turret for basketballs but we did make a catapult for the pelicans our local NBA team

this is the only pic but it was a piston that shot up when we hit a button and it made it into a goal every time. But know it has just fallen into disrepair sadly

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T13:39:12.635Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":370,"readers_count":369,"score":94.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500221,"topic_slug":"were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project","display_username":"Miles.D","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68136,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3039 Team captain"},"post_url":"/t/were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project/500221/4","custom_user_title":"3039 Team captain","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3601182,"name":"","username":"NYtoWI","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nytowi/{size}/159490_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T13:47:37.278Z","cooked":"

There was a small competition a few years ago called Bot Shot that was sponsored by Land o Lakes that involved basketball shooting robots. Only 1 robot had a turret from what I remember, from UMN Robotics. This is their reveal video. Some of the folks that actually worked on this bot might be on CD still. There’s probably other information out there if you look for it.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T13:47:37.278Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":331,"readers_count":330,"score":131.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":500221,"topic_slug":"were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RskrbFtGr6k&ab_channel=UniversityofMinnesotaRobotics","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":26}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":68136,"username":"jom","name":"Miles.D","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jom/{size}/256684_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40758,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6421 Mechanical/Strategy Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project/500221/5","custom_user_title":"6421 Mechanical/Strategy Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3601236,"name":"Miles.D","username":"jom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jom/{size}/256684_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T14:24:39.545Z","cooked":"

The 2022 ball is very similar to the size of a standard basket ball so what I would recommend to you is to go watch some of the behind the bumpers from 2022. but also 2012 would also be great to look at.

1: how to drive it

SWERVE BABY!!! Just kidding your best bet is probably some kind of tank with air tires so you can drive it in all different places. I have been to a lot of different out reach with main season robots, and I will say people do not really like the tread marks swerve leaves behind.

we’re thinking around 6000rpm and 270 degrees of rotation

if I am correct 270 was really standard in 2022 (or at least that’s what we had)

we want it to be able to make a 3point shot on a basketball hoop consistently (95/100 makes)

that is probably going to be fairly hard but also possible some solutions, I can think of is to have an April tag that you can put at the same height and a few inches forward of the goal. probably going to need something like this

But if you guys are bringing your own goal to places somehow it should not really be to big of a problem to mount an April tag directly to the goal.

and if you do not have the budget for a limelight or you guys cant get one you should look into photon vision, its a bit less plug in play but I heard its still really solid.

In conclusion

This is a very cool idea and I think it would be great if you guys could get it fully working! (I am just a programmer so I wish I could give you more advice on the mechanical side but I just cant sorry)

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T14:24:39.545Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":305,"readers_count":304,"score":71.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500221,"topic_slug":"were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project","display_username":"Miles.D","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68136,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3039 Team captain"},"post_url":"/t/were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project/500221/6","custom_user_title":"3039 Team captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3601324,"name":"Eli Milholland","username":"Bobert9000","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/50afbb/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T15:12:49.084Z","cooked":"

We were going to run a kraken maxswerve as on off-season project (slap on the turret when we have that) also we have already ran 2 photon vision cams for our offseason last year and mainseason this year. I might look into getting a portable hoop aswell

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T15:12:49.084Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":242,"readers_count":241,"score":63.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":500221,"topic_slug":"were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project","display_username":"Eli Milholland","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":68136,"username":"jom","name":"Miles.D","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jom/{size}/256684_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66903,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Best freshmen :)"},"post_url":"/t/were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project/500221/7","custom_user_title":"Best freshmen :)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3601488,"name":"Karl Olson","username":"olsonkarlp","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/b9bd4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T16:40:26.503Z","cooked":"

I was one of those students! Not a turret, but a hooded shooter, yes. I’m happy to answer any questions about it.

A quick note: You need a LOT of power to shoot a real, full basketball. They are way way heavier than typical FRC game pieces.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T16:40:26.503Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":207,"readers_count":206,"score":66.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":500221,"topic_slug":"were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project","display_username":"Karl Olson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":40758,"username":"NYtoWI","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nytowi/{size}/159490_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36434,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Technical Mentor | 3476"},"post_url":"/t/were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project/500221/8","custom_user_title":"Technical Mentor | 3476","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3601502,"name":"","username":"NYtoWI","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nytowi/{size}/159490_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T16:49:20.092Z","cooked":"

I agree on the lot of power aspect. We used 4 redline motors on our shooter for that competition.

Other thing to keep in mind is the inflation level of the ball. A few psi of difference can change how far the basketball is launched by quite a bit. It wasn’t as noticable in 2022 because the goal was 4ft wide. When you’re aiming for a normal basketball hoop, 1" of variance is quite signifigant.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T16:49:20.092Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":197,"readers_count":196,"score":49.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":500221,"topic_slug":"were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":36434,"username":"olsonkarlp","name":"Karl Olson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/b9bd4f/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40758,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6421 Mechanical/Strategy Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project/500221/9","custom_user_title":"6421 Mechanical/Strategy Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3601506,"name":"Travis","username":"BSV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bsv/{size}/228025_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T16:51:41.063Z","cooked":"

Make sure you have wheels that are court-safe (we are going with pneumatic wheels on our new design, and a tank drive base). After about 8 appearances, a swerve robot of ours may or may not have scuffed an NBA court and may or may not have been banned from said court and had to do the next demonstration from the sidelines

Our summer project is the same thing – dedicated basketball bot with turret that auto-tracks the basket.

We are looking at foam basketballs, maybe, for this. That way we can have it play catch with people as well. Something like this (although I guess I need to run to Academy to see if it’s a possibility or not).

Edit: it’s a 29.5" foam basketball with some bounce, so 9.4" diameter.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T18:21:31.980Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":184,"readers_count":183,"score":56.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":500221,"topic_slug":"were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project","display_username":"Travis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.academy.com/p/silent-hoops-basketball","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Access to this page has been denied.","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20982,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Travis -- e-possum - FRC team# (Σ 1/n! x 10^3) -- Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project/500221/10","custom_user_title":"Travis -- e-possum - FRC team# (Σ 1/n! x 10^3) -- Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3601524,"name":"Eli Milholland","username":"Bobert9000","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/50afbb/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T17:01:16.691Z","cooked":"

The basketball hoop is surprisingly big, but hopefully the basketballs dont lose too much psi

Bobert9000:

torque/ rpms

A lot and a lot. We had some very significant (SCARY!!!) flywheels. You can hear them throughout our reveal, and that’s with the volume turned way down. Everyone working on it had earplugs for test sessions. I wouldn’t necessarily recommend it, but if you go this route, please be very careful and get a mentor to review it for safety. It is important that your flywheels are well-balanced and best if you can put a cage around them on the robot.

To hit from 3pt range, you will need the basketball to be going at least ~35 ft/s, which means the linear speed of your shooting wheel needs to be similar (and not lose energy during the shot, which is why we had big flywheels). The RPM depends on the size of your shooting wheel.

I will also note something that we wished we changed - You should have a second wheel/roller at the top of the hood. We were wasting a lot of energy into putting an absurd amount of backspin onto the ball. You want some, probably, but not as much as you get if you have a single wheel powerful enough to shoot 3 point shots.

If I were building one today, I would prefer an AprilTag on the backboard. If you have to set up quickly, maybe you could make a small mounting jig that could interface with the back of the hoop.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T17:59:20.557Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":124,"readers_count":123,"score":39.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":500221,"topic_slug":"were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project","display_username":"Karl Olson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":68136,"username":"jom","name":"Miles.D","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jom/{size}/256684_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36434,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Technical Mentor | 3476"},"post_url":"/t/were-looking-for-some-help-on-building-a-turret-for-basketballs-offseason-project/500221/17","custom_user_title":"Technical Mentor | 3476","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3601610,"name":"Sahil Kahn","username":"sahilk","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/ce7236/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T18:10:24.970Z","cooked":"

270° of travel is a reasonable number. I know that many teams in 2022 had around that much travel. Depending on your desires, you could explore doing more travel on a turret, so having to “unwrap” the turret is less common. Teams like 2910 and 254 had roughly 720° of travel on their turrets in 2024, which made them better at a role that required them to turn the robot a lot when intaking.

I hope you’re referring to the flywheel speed and not the final reduction on the turret, because 6000 RPM is an extremely high number for turret rotation. At that speed, you’re looking at a full 270° sweep in under 8 milliseconds.

The motor power required to do this, coupled with the absurd speeds and the control loop timing, could easily tear this mechanism apart the first time it tried to run anywhere close to full speed.

For some context: tracking a stationary goal while moving laterally at 20 ft/s halfway to the 3pt line only demands about 100°/sec of turret rotation. Even accounting for drivetrain rotation in the opposite direction at 360°/sec, 400–500°/sec (70–80 RPM) is already generous and gives you the headroom needed for fast, responsive aiming.

As for flywheel speeds: you can calculate an appropriate exit velocity based on the distances you want to shoot. Once you have a target exit velocity, you can back-calculate the necessary wheel surface speed. If you’re using a passive hood, your shooter wheels will need a surface speed roughly twice your desired exit velocity. Keep in mind that real-world factors like slip and compression losses can reduce your actual exit speed, so it’s smart to prototype and validate your numbers, or leave some headroom for tuning.

All of my math is back-of-the-napkin, so I heavily suggest doing your own calculations to find a good speed for your turret given the power and torque available from the motor you will have driving it and your desired tracking speeds, or at the very least, reference the ratios that teams have used in the past. I’d also look at the CAD that teams have published for turrets they have used in the past for inspiration on how to package and power them.
